title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while a court case is still ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, removing a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up the operating system without an internet connection or logging into an account. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and logged in during setup.
summary: Microsoft has updated the Windows 11 Insider Preview, eliminating the option to bypass the internet connection and account login requirements during setup. Now, all Windows 11 devices must be connected to the internet and logged into an account during the installation process.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway until Monday, March 31st, offering numerous deals on a wide range of products. These deals are available to all customers, not just Amazon Prime members. The sale includes over 100 deals on popular gear, and a separate roundup highlights affordable options for budget-conscious shoppers.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is happening until March 31st, featuring over 100 deals on various products, open to all customers including non-Prime members. The sale also offers a selection of affordable options for those on a budget.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion in debt. This acquisition comes a few years after Musk originally bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion of debt. This move follows Musk's initial acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion a few years prior.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11 devices. This feature aims to enable IT professionals to remotely recover devices that won't boot, a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous year's Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature is designed to help IT professionals remotely recover devices that are unable to boot, aiming to prevent issues like the previous Crowdstrike incident.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their existing accounts to a Google account until next year. This update follows the company's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021 and its subsequent integration of Fitbit’s services with its own. The original deadline was set for 2025.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts to next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in 2021. This extension moves the original migration deadline, initially set for 2025.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'

summary: Researchers have created a growth factor cocktail that reversed severe cell damage in mice with anthrax, indicating a possibility for human treatment adaptation.

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have created an advanced model using AI and machine learning to predict chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients more accurately. This model combines whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analyses, offering superior performance compared to earlier models that relied on only one type of data.
summary: Researchers have developed a new AI and machine learning model that accurately predicts chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients by combining whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analyses. This approach outperforms previous models that used only one data type.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a direct link between dopamine levels and cognitive flexibility, showing that increased dopamine production in the brain is associated with better performance on challenging tasks. This finding, revealed through PET imaging, suggests the potential for developing targeted treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Scientists have found a direct connection between dopamine levels in the brain and cognitive flexibility, using PET imaging. Higher dopamine production correlates with improved performance on difficult tasks. This discovery opens avenues for creating specific treatments for neurological and psychiatric conditions.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This insight could help in understanding how to tackle latent infections in the nervous system.
summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can detect and control the dormant stage of Toxoplasma gondii, a parasite. This discovery could aid in developing strategies to address latent infections in the nervous system.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species worldwide has found that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers play key roles in determining why certain plants thrive in specific regions but not in others. The research explored how these patterns of plant distribution have evolved over millions of years, highlighting the influence of geography and climate on global plant diversity.
summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species revealed that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers significantly influence plant distribution, explaining why some plants are found in certain areas but not others. This research, which examined plant diversity over millions of years, underscores the impact of geography and climate on where plants thrive worldwide.
